key_points: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers won their second Super Bowl by defeating the Kansas City Chiefs.
Tom Brady, Buccaneers quarterback, was the highest-paid player in the 2021 Super Bowl, earning an average annual salary of $25 million.
Brady's salary was less than the previous Super Bowl's highest-paid player, 49ers quarterback Jimmy Garoppolo, who earned $27.5 million.
This season, Brady got a pay increase after leaving the New England Patriots, having earned around $23 million in 2019.
NFL player salaries vary yearly based on contracts, salary caps, bonuses, performance incentives, and endorsements.
Brady's current two-year contract has multiple bonus incentives, totaling $750,000 for a wild card win, $1.25 million for an NFC Championship, and $1.75 million for reaching the Super Bowl.
Brady qualified for a $2.25 million bonus with the Buccaneers' Super Bowl win, in addition to the $130,000 each winning team player receives.
Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes signed a 10-year contract extension with an average annual salary of $45 million starting next season.
Despite being the highest-paid in the Super Bowl, Brady is tied for the fifteenth-highest salary in the NFL.
Tom Brady earned $25 million with the Buccaneers, marking an increase from his time with the Patriots.
